https://prez.dev/description.@value: All operations and activities are terminated. The operator has left the site with no intention of returning to the borehole/well. The borehole/well is not necessarily plugged, and its site may not have been properly rehabilitated/remediated (e.g., may include boreholes drilled prior to mandatory rehabilitation legislation coming into effect).

An abandoned borehole/well that has been cased. Boreholes with poor integrity, such as corroded casing, have the potential to provide a pathway for gases and/or liquids to migrate into or between aquifers or to the surface. [e.g., IESC, 2014]
All casing has been removed from the borehole. Part of the post-operational phase of abandonment
Borehole has been cemented. Part of the process of post-operational phase of abandonment.
Equipment has been left in the borehole — the nature of the equipment and the depth should be recorded.
An object has been left in the borehole which may need to be avoided, mitigated or removed prior to mining.

A borehole/well in which all penetrated zones with flow potential have been permanently isolated from surface and from lower pressured zones. Wellhead/conductor has been removed unless approved to leave in situ. Well has not yet been accepted by the regulatory authority (e.g., NOPSEMA, state regulators for CSG wells, etc.) as abandoned. The borehole/well at this stage in its life cycle is effectively ‘permanently suspended’.
The subject is an instance of a class.
The defininition of the subject resource.
An idea or notion; a unit of thought
Relates a concept to a concept that is more general in meaning
A statement or formal explanation of the meaning of a concept

skos:exactMatch is used to link two concepts, indicating a high degree of confidence that the concepts can be used interchangeably across a wide range of information retrieval applications. skos:exactMatch is a transitive property, and is a sub-property of skos:closeMatch
A note about the past state/use/meaning of a concept
Relates a resource (for example a concept) to a concept scheme in which it is included
skos:narrowMatch is used to state a hierarchical mapping link between two conceptual resources in different concept schemes
Relates a concept to a concept that is more specific in meaning
A notation, also known as classification code, is a string of characters such as 'T58.5' or '303.4833' used to uniquely identify a concept within the scope of a given concept scheme
The preferred lexical label for a resource, in a given language
skos:relatedMatch is used to state an associative mapping link between two conceptual resources in different concept schemes

The stage of a borehole in relation to the lifecycle of the borehole, from proposal and operational stages through to completion and rehabilitation, and with a focus on terminology as applied in the Geological Survey of Western Australia (GSWA) databases. The vocabulary focuses on standard terminology from the energy and mineral resources sectors, highlighting instances where the same term carries different meaning in different fields. In the context of this vocabulary, the term fluid energy refers to sources such as gas, petroleum and geothermal, as covered by the Petroleum Legislation Amendment Act 2024, and is exclusive of mineral sources of energy (e.g. coal, uranium). Note that the currency of borehole status data in GSWA's databases is time-stamped, reflecting information gathered from a borehole operator’s well completion report or from a responsible regulatory authority at a specific point in time; subsequent changes are unlikely to be recorded.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: All borehole operations and activities are terminated. The operator has left the site with no intention of returning to the borehole. Note that this is similar to 'completed' status in the Australian Coal Logging Standards v3.1 (CoalLog). Also note that 'abandoned - energy' is similar to 'rehabilitated' as used by the mineral resources industry.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value: Energy industry concept. Definition adapted from Geoscience Australia's Borehole Status vocabulary (in turn modified from PPDM Wellbore Status vocabulary, 2014).

https://prez.dev/description.@value: All borehole operations and activities are terminated. The operator has left the site with no intention of returning to the borehole. Note that this is similar to 'completed' status in the Australian Coal Logging Standards v3.1 (CoalLog). Also note that 'abandoned - energy' is similar to 'rehabilitated' as used by the mineral resources industry.

An abandoned borehole that has also been plugged. The extent of seal may vary from just plugged near the surface (e.g. many coal boreholes) to plugged to prevent the migration of oil, gas, water or other substance from one stratum to another (i.e. PPDM definition). Note that 'plugged and abandoned ' is similar to 'plugged' as used by the mineral resources industry.

All operations and activities are terminated. The operator has left the site with no intention of returning to the borehole. The borehole is not necessarily plugged.  Similar to CoalLog status "completed".
A profile for SKOS Concept Schemes
A citation or reference to another creative work, such as another publication, web page, scholarly article, etc
